alert.note: Alert for Cass (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 7:25PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Cass County through 800 PM CDT... At 725 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout near Durbin, or 15 miles southwest of Fargo, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, winds in excess of 40 mph, and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Casselton, Kindred, Davenport, Durbin and Mapleton. This includes Interstate 94 in North Dakota between mile markers 329 and 338. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for southeastern North Dakota.
